entry.title: Heroku
entry.content:
heroku login
heroku create [name]

heroku git:remote -a `cat .git/config | grep heroku.com | awk -F [/.] '{print $6}'`
git init

git commit -am '`date +%Y-%m-%d:%H:%M:%S`' git push heroku master

reset base

heroku restart; heroku pg:reset DATABASE --confirm `cat .git/config | grep heroku.com | awk -F [/.] '{print $6}'` && heroku run rake db:migrate

entry.title: Devise_use_name
Network_interfaces
entry.content: interface = /sys/class/net mac = /sys/class/net/*/address

entry.title: Display
Test_disk
entry.content:
apt install smartmontools
smartctl -H /dev/sda
smartctl -A /dev/sda
badblocks -vs /dev/sda

Days

Sorting-a-two-dimensional-array
entry.content:
ref https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7033719/sorting-a-two-dimensional-array-by-second-value

arr.sort_by{|x,y|y} arr.sort_by(&:last)

entry.title: Fuzzystringmatch
entry.content:
https://github.com/kiyoka/fuzzy-string-match

require ‘fuzzystringmatch’ jarow = FuzzyStringMatch::JaroWinkler.create( :native ) p jarow.getDistance( “jones”, “johnson” )

entry.title: Save_last_directory
entry.content:
Save last working directory on Bash logout

ref https://stackoverflow.com/questions/767040/save-last-working-directory-on-bash-logout

entry.title: Gmail
entry.content: curl -u username:password --silent "https://mail.google.com/mail/feed/atom" | tr -d '\n' | awk -F '<entry>' '{for (i=2; i<=NF; i++) {print $i}}' | sed -n "s/<title>\(.*\)<\/title.*name>\(.*\)<\/name>.*/\2 - \1/p"

entry.title: Remove_black
Infinity
entry.content:
Infinity

ref https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5778295/how-to-express-infinity-in-ruby

PositiveInfinity = +1.0/0.0 => Infinity

NegativeInfinity = -1.0/0.0 => -Infinity

CompleteInfinity = NegativeInfinity..PositiveInfinity => -Infinity..Infinity
